description: Updates a Lambda function's code. If code signing is enabled for the function, the code package must be signed by a trusted publisher. For more information, see Configuring code signing for Lambda. If the function's package type is Image, then you must specify the code package in ImageUri as the URI of a container image in the Amazon ECR registry. If the function's package type is Zip, then you must specify the deployment package as a .zip file archive. Enter the Amazon S3 bucket and key of the code .zip file location. You can also provide the function code inline using the ZipFile field. The code in the deployment package must be compatible with the target instruction set architecture of the function ( x86-64 or arm64). The function's code is locked when you publish a version. You can't modify the code of a published version, only the unpublished version.

parameters.name: FunctionName
parameters.description: The name or ARN of the Lambda function. Function name --- my-function. Function ARN --- arn:aws:lambda:us-west-2:123456789012:function:my-function. Partial ARN --- 123456789012:function:my-function. The length constraint applies only to the full ARN. If you specify only the function name, it is limited to 64 characters in length.

parameters.name: ZipFile
parameters.description: The base64-encoded contents of the deployment package. Amazon Web Services SDK and CLI clients handle the encoding for you. Use only with a function defined with a .zip file archive deployment package.

parameters.name: Architectures
parameters.description: The instruction set architecture that the function supports. Enter a string array with one of the valid values (arm64 or x86_64). The default value is x86_64. (string) ---

nested_items.name: FunctionName
nested_items.description: The name of the function.

nested_items.name: FunctionArn
nested_items.description: The function's Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

nested_items.name: Runtime
nested_items.description: The identifier of the function's runtime. Runtime is required if the deployment package is a .zip file archive. Specifying a runtime results in an error if you're deploying a function using a container image.

nested_items.name: Role
nested_items.description: The function's execution role.

nested_items.name: Handler
nested_items.description: The function that Lambda calls to begin running your function.

nested_items.name: CodeSize
nested_items.description: The size of the function's deployment package, in bytes.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The function's description.

nested_items.name: Timeout
nested_items.description: The amount of time in seconds that Lambda allows a function to run before stopping it.

nested_items.name: MemorySize
nested_items.description: The amount of memory available to the function at runtime.

nested_items.name: LastModified
nested_items.description: The date and time that the function was last updated, in ISO-8601 format (YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD).

nested_items.name: CodeSha256
nested_items.description: The SHA256 hash of the function's deployment package.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The version of the Lambda function.

nested_items.name: VpcConfig
nested_items.description: The function's networking configuration.

nested_items.name: SubnetIds
nested_items.description: A list of VPC subnet IDs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SecurityGroupIds
nested_items.description: A list of VPC security group IDs.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: The ID of the VPC.

nested_items.name: Ipv6AllowedForDualStack
nested_items.description: Allows outbound IPv6 traffic on VPC functions that are connected to dual-stack subnets.

nested_items.name: DeadLetterConfig
nested_items.description: The function's dead letter queue.

nested_items.name: TargetArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an Amazon SQS queue or Amazon SNS topic.

nested_items.name: Environment
nested_items.description: The function's environment variables. Omitted from CloudTrail logs.

nested_items.name: Variables
nested_items.description: Environment variable key-value pairs. Omitted from CloudTrail logs.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ErrorCode
nested_items.description: The error code.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: The error message.

nested_items.name: KMSKeyArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the Key Management Service (KMS) customer managed key that's used to encrypt the following resources:
The function's environment variables.
The function's Lambda SnapStart snapshots.
When used with SourceKMSKeyArn, the unzipped version of the .zip deployment package that's used for function invocations. For more information, see Specifying a customer managed key for Lambda.

The optimized version of the container image that's used for function invocations. Note that this is not the same key that's used to protect your container image in the Amazon Elastic Container Registry (Amazon ECR). For more information, see Function lifecycle.

nested_items.name: TracingConfig
nested_items.description: The function's X-Ray tracing configuration.

nested_items.name: Mode
nested_items.description: The tracing mode.

nested_items.name: MasterArn
nested_items.description: For Lambda@Edge functions, the ARN of the main function.

nested_items.name: RevisionId
nested_items.description: The latest updated revision of the function or alias.

nested_items.name: Layers
nested_items.description: The function's layers.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the function layer.

nested_items.name: CodeSize
nested_items.description: The size of the layer archive in bytes.

nested_items.name: SigningProfileVersionArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a signing profile version.

nested_items.name: SigningJobArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of a signing job.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The current state of the function. When the state is Inactive, you can reactivate the function by invoking it.

nested_items.name: StateReason
nested_items.description: The reason for the function's current state.

nested_items.name: StateReasonCode
nested_items.description: The reason code for the function's current state. When the code is Creating, you can't invoke or modify the function.

nested_items.name: LastUpdateStatus
nested_items.description: The status of the last update that was performed on the function. This is first set to Successful after function creation completes.

nested_items.name: LastUpdateStatusReason
nested_items.description: The reason for the last update that was performed on the function.

nested_items.name: LastUpdateStatusReasonCode
nested_items.description: The reason code for the last update that was performed on the function.

nested_items.name: FileSystemConfigs
nested_items.description: Connection settings for an Amazon EFS file system.

nested_items.name: Arn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the Amazon EFS access point that provides access to the file system.

nested_items.name: LocalMountPath
nested_items.description: The path where the function can access the file system, starting with /mnt/.

nested_items.name: PackageType
nested_items.description: The type of deployment package. Set to Image for container image and set Zip for .zip file archive.

nested_items.name: ImageConfigResponse
nested_items.description: The function's image configuration values.

nested_items.name: ImageConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration values that override the container image Dockerfile.

nested_items.name: EntryPoint
nested_items.description: Specifies the entry point to their application, which is typically the location of the runtime executable.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: Command
nested_items.description: Specifies parameters that you want to pass in with ENTRYPOINT.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: WorkingDirectory
nested_items.description: Specifies the working directory.

nested_items.name: ErrorCode
nested_items.description: Error code.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: Error message.

nested_items.name: SigningProfileVersionArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the signing profile version.

nested_items.name: SigningJobArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the signing job.

nested_items.name: Architectures
nested_items.description: The instruction set architecture that the function supports. Architecture is a string array with one of the valid values. The default architecture value is x86_64.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: EphemeralStorage
nested_items.description: The size of the function's /tmp directory in MB. The default value is 512, but can be any whole number between 512 and 10,240 MB. For more information, see Configuring ephemeral storage (console).

nested_items.name: Size
nested_items.description: The size of the function's /tmp directory.

nested_items.name: SnapStart
nested_items.description: Set ApplyOn to PublishedVersions to create a snapshot of the initialized execution environment when you publish a function version. For more information, see Improving startup performance with Lambda SnapStart.

nested_items.name: ApplyOn
nested_items.description: When set to PublishedVersions, Lambda creates a snapshot of the execution environment when you publish a function version.

nested_items.name: OptimizationStatus
nested_items.description: When you provide a qualified Amazon Resource Name (ARN), this response element indicates whether SnapStart is activated for the specified function version.

nested_items.name: RuntimeVersionConfig
nested_items.description: The ARN of the runtime and any errors that occured.

nested_items.name: RuntimeVersionArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the runtime version you want the function to use.

nested_items.name: ErrorCode
nested_items.description: The error code.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: The error message.

nested_items.name: LoggingConfig
nested_items.description: The function's Amazon CloudWatch Logs configuration settings.

nested_items.name: LogFormat
nested_items.description: The format in which Lambda sends your function's application and system logs to CloudWatch. Select between plain text and structured JSON.

nested_items.name: ApplicationLogLevel
nested_items.description: Set this property to filter the application logs for your function that Lambda sends to CloudWatch. Lambda only sends application logs at the selected level of detail and lower, where TRACE is the highest level and FATAL is the lowest.

nested_items.name: SystemLogLevel
nested_items.description: Set this property to filter the system logs for your function that Lambda sends to CloudWatch. Lambda only sends system logs at the selected level of detail and lower, where DEBUG is the highest level and WARN is the lowest.

nested_items.name: LogGroup
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon CloudWatch log group the function sends logs to. By default, Lambda functions send logs to a default log group named /aws/lambda/<function name>. To use a different log group, enter an existing log group or enter a new log group name.
